author: redbeardlegoman
title: You're my butterfly
review:
I didn't think that I would love this figure as much as my five-year-old daughter does, but I do.

Those wings!  I mean, how awesome are those wings?!  When I first saw the picture, I didn't really look at them, and just kind of assumed they were the bee wings from Bee Girl or Ballet Batman.  When I saw that they were full on butterfly wings, I got more than a little giggly.

For me, though, the best part is the butterfly print tank top.  I have a clothing store MOC that is going to have one of those on a mannequin the next time I expand it.  It's adorable.

I can live with the hair piece being printed.  It might be nice to have one like that in plain, but if I really, absolutely have to have one, there's always Brasso.

This little girl is screaming for her own birthday party MOC, or as a rave girl with the addition of longer legs.

author: Odeinoichus
title: Can we expect a Caterpiller Girl in the future?
review:
Set #71018 Butterfly Girl: Is this meant to be another costumed character? Or is just a kid dressed up for Halloween/a Play of some sort? Either way it's pretty interesting.

Wearing brightly painted Butterfly wings, which I believe is a new piece, the Butterfly Girl has a limited torso print and minor leg printing on her short LEGO legs for some kind of shoes or slippers or something. With some cute flower markings on her hair and cheek and carrying a LEGO bouquet element, the Butterfly Girl is a fun little addition from Series 17, however not one of the stronger offerings.

If you're aiming to have a complete set, or want those new wings for a MOC then I'd recommend picking her up. If you aren't too impressed with cute costumes and adorable children dressed up I feel you'd be better off skipping her. Recommended.
